message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.LG, cs.MM

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory): The paper deals with the optimization of the MIMO broadcast channels to maximize the weighted sum-rate subject to power constraints. This falls under the domain of information theory, which is concerned with the transmission, processing, and utilization of information. 
2. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): The paper discusses the downlink MIMO broadcast channels in which a base transceiver station (BTS) broadcasts multiple data streams to MIMO mobile stations (MSs). This falls under the domain of networking and internet architecture, which deals with the design, implementation, and management of computer networks and communication systems. 
3. cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper proposes an efficient stochastic optimization algorithm to optimize the transceiver matrices. This falls under the domain of systems and control, which deals with the analysis, design, and control of complex systems. 
4. cs.LG (Machine Learning): The paper utilizes the linear minimum mean square error (MMSE) Wiener filters at MSs. This falls under the domain of machine learning, which deals with the development of algorithms and models that enable computers to learn from data and make predictions or decisions. 
5. cs.MM (Multimedia): The paper discusses the transmission of multiple data streams in MIMO broadcast channels. This falls under the domain of multimedia, which deals with the processing, storage
